etymology.description: 多(多) (duō, "many") + 音(音) (yīn, "sound") + 字(字) (zì, "character"; "word")
etymology.interpretation: The term 多音字 (duōyīnzì) refers to a character that can be pronounced in multiple ways, each possibly with a different meaning. The combination of 多(多) (duō, "many"), 音(音) (yīn, "sound"), and 字(字) (zì, "character") effectively describes a character with multiple pronunciations.

examples.chinese: ‘数’是一个多音字(‘數’是一個多音字)。
读出一个多音字时(讀出一個多音字時)，需要根据不同的语境(需要根據不同的語境)。
examples.pinyin: Dú chū yīgè duōyīn zì shí, xūyào gēnjù bùtóng de yǔjìng.
examples.english: When pronouncing a polyphonic character, one needs to consider the different contexts.
